channel.title: BUbuisnessAndMarket
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbuisnessAndMarket, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Why investors shouldn’t sweat this inflation report
item.description: The latest inflation report came in hotter than expected, but there are some encouraging signs within it.

item.title: Most Americans who want to lose weight don’t want to take GLP-1 drugs like Wegovy and Zepbound, new survey says
item.description: Men, Baby Boomers, and postgraduate degree-holders were among those most likely to say they wouldn’t choose medication over dieting.

item.title: U.S. stock-market futures pushed lower by inflation and jobless-claims data
Pfizer threatened to sue renegade executives prior to activist schism, Starboard's Smith says
item.description: Starboard's Jeff Smith called on the company to assemble a special committee to investigate the matter, describing it as "flagrantly unethical."

item.title: Inflation rate hit 2.4% in September, topping expectations; jobless claims highest since August 2023
item.description: The consumer price index was expected to show a 0.1% increase in September and a 2.3% gain from a year ago, according to Dow Jones consensus estimates...

item.title: Retirees will get $50 more from Social Security every month starting next year—but that’s a drop in the bucket compared to years past
item.description: Over 70 million people receive Social Security benefits.

item.title: Social Security recipients to get $50 bump for 2025 as inflation cools
item.description: After years of high inflation, the COLA is coming back down to earth.

item.title: U.S. stock indexes modestly lower after September inflation data — live coverage
A top affirmative action lawyer said that some companies are caving to DEI criticism because ‘they’re wimps’
item.description: Neal Katyal said that many fears over legal retribution are unwarranted.

item.title: U.S. first-time jobless claims jump to highest level in more than a year
Zuckerberg's metaverse is finally showing signs of life, but it's not from VR
item.description: The company formerly known as Facebook appears to have found its footing in virtual and augmented reality through a different medium.

item.title: Wall Street’s so-called fear gauge experiencing turbulence as Election Day nears
Swiss workers must clock out for bathroom breaks, court rules
item.description: “Swiss law does not mention the right of employees to go to the toilet.”

item.title: Social Security Administration announces 2.5% cost-of-living adjustment for 2025
item.description: The Social Security Administration has announced a 2.5% cost-of-living adjustment for 2025.

item.title: Social Security cost-of-living adjustment for 2025 is smaller than 2024’s
